DB Migration, Aug’2016 to Dec’2016, Santander, UK
Migration process is transferring data from one application to a different customized application without loosing any current data and ensuring there are no functional breakdowns from entities to UI pages. 
· To analyze the source and target database functionalities and map entities module wise.
· Write Stored Procedures to retrieve source data and develop microflows to absorb data from the source and functionally transfer them to respective target entities.
· Understand the gaps and document the entire process including the advantages and back drops in using DB Connector and provide further analysis on how to handle the breakdowns and gaps during migration process. 
DB Migration using DB Replicator, Jun’2016 to Aug’2016, Santander, UK

To study the possibilities to migrate data from source application to a new customized application, to figure out the accuracy and ease in migrating data using DB Replication, a module which is specially meant for data migration.
· To extensively work on two of the modules, its entities, pages, attributes and associations.
· To connect DB Replication to the database, test connectivity and synchronize all tables.
· Map the table structures and see if data is imported or not.
· Analyse the trouble shooting and debugging possibilities using DB Replicator.
· Analyse the functional breakdowns and backdrops of DB Replicator.

Peoplesoft

Support project which requires immediate attention to the user queries and data issues from Technical, HR, Payroll, benefits and Time & Labor areas. New requirements, requirement changes, user training/education, bug fixes and issue analysis are taken care of.

· Monitor Production Nightly Batch Process, create tickets and notify the team.

· Prepare scripts for data changes and validations.

· Functional – Worked on HR, Payroll and Benefits areas.

ESL Benefits Grants, Esterline, UK, September'2013 to April'2014
Project verifies the Eligibility Enrollment Verification of employees having Share Save Plan in 4Z Plan Type and sends employee data to Watson Watt for benefit plan purposes. Adds contracts from Share Save plan that needs enrolling contract details and Flat Amount Tax data.

· To create setup pages and customize existing functionality to load employee contract details.
· Work on SQR reports and SQR inbound interfaces information in various modes.

· Create PL/SQL scripts to implement the Share Save plan Eligibility.

· Migrate project from Development to Functional environment.

UASSIST (uQuestionnaire, uSQR Analyzer, uCustomizer), March'2013 to August'2013, Esterline, UK
UQuestionnaire has a set of Questions aimed to collect all the information to initiate an upgrade project originated from various business case studies like General, Administrative, Environmental and Functional.
USQR Analyzer Lists all the SQRs that need changes with respect to table structure changes in new release of PeopleTools. It lists all changes needed in individual SQR and provides functionality to auto apply the changes. The user then decides whether changes are needed and does it manually.
UCustomizer identifies and retrofits documented as well as undocumented customizations in a Peoplesoft environment. It analyzes the changes to online objects wrt to the version change or tools upgrade.

· As primary developer, to develop fields to menus and defined keys, indexes and also table edits – used as validations performed on the record fields.

· Write PeopleCode and App Engine Programs to implement the requirements.

Labor Distribution, July'2012 to February'2013, Weyerhaeuser, USA
Weyerhaeuser migrated from Mainframe GEAC application to SAP Financials. PeopleSoft HCM application was interfacing to SAP Financials through Labor Distribution system developed as Bolt-On to GEAC application. This project is to redesign the process to integrate PeopleSoft Payroll directly to SAP Financials.
· Involved in development of new SQRs and customization of several delivered SQRs.

· Create setup and run control pages for the new SQR’s developed and create outbound interfaces.
· To migrate project from Dev to Functional and Acceptance environments.
· Prepare Technical specification documents.

Tax Updates (08C, 08D, 08E, 08F, 09A, 09B, 09C and 09D), 6 months, Weyerhaeuser, USA
Six times a year, modifications to PeopleSoft applications are submitted as Bundles/Patches.
Perform the necessary changes to all data elements and make sure that there is no functional breakdown in the process.
· To download and extract bundles, to prepare list of all 3rd party objects with customizations and document the changes for each customization found.

· To run the compare reports and develop Weyerhaeuser customizations and Functional test end to end payroll and BenAdmin process.

Esterline Upgradation, August'2011 to September'2011, Esterline, UK
To upgrade the latest Maintenance Packs 6 and 7 to the current Peoplesoft HRMS 9.0 version. Compare reports are run to find the customizations to Esterline objects. Changes to online and 3rd party objects are done and unit tested for the same.

· To download the maintenance packages and document the online and 3rd party object changes with respect to MP5 Cumulative and MP6 Delta. 
· Run compare reports to find the customizations, develop the customized objects and perform unit testing.

· To migrate the project to Functional environment.

· Functional test end to end Workforce Administration process and Esterline customized process.

Project Profile #

OnBlick (RIG Enterprise Applications Pvt. Ltd.,):

OnBlick is a first of its kind application that integrates a Job Board, Activity Tracking System, professional networking and all communication tools, to completely automate your hiring and tracking process. It brings the key elements of the industry together on one platform, to simplify your overall recruitment experience.

Intelligent Search: 

Intelligent search fetches only the most suitable jobs for your profile. It extensively reduces the

Time spent on job searching by eliminating any irrelevant jobs.

Compatibility Match:

Unique compatibility algorithm evaluates the compatibility between your profile and job requirements based on 5 key parameters. This algorithm gives a complete analysis of why you match a job and where you may fall short on skills.

ATS:

Activity Tracking System (ATS) helps you track all the activities around a job search within the system, by syncing every update& action within the app. This helps you forgo the need to use & maintain different systems in their job search.
InApp Communication:

InApp Communication feature helps you communicate with the recruiters within the application using features like InApp Emailing, InApp Messaging and InApp Calling. This significantly reduces the time &effort spent on getting connected with right opportunities or right people.

GeekBot Assistant:

This AI & NLP powered GeekBot not only filters, but also communicates with recruiters to identify potential opportunities on your behalf while you are busy or away.  

Contact Manager: 

All your contacts along with your interactions (calls, chats, mails and updates) with them are automatically saved in your contact manager, so you never ever lose touch with your contacts. You can always touch base from where you left with any contact.

  

Trends

Market Trends:

Market Trends gives you a clear picture of market’s demand & supply in specific technical and functional domains. With these insights you can understand the market better and make more guided decisions for your career. 

Tech Trends:

Tech Trends identifies the trending technologies and skills for you. This helps you make better decisions in upgrading skills. 

Personal Trends:

Personal Trends gives a complete synopsis of your job applications. You can easily review the statistics of your application against the number of shortlisting and interviews you profile received.

The Field Spend Capture application is developed for medical sales representatives (known as 1099) to track the on-filed expenses.

The Mobile Applications will be used by medical representatives who are the employees of Smith and nephew and he/she will be assigned to some health care providers to whom they have to advertise about their products. 

The Admin App is for the application RVPs, Managers and Sales Reps who can login to check and approve the transactions made by the reps on specific dates following the HIPPA compliance. Set of functionalities are also provided where they can assign the Healthcare Providers to the reps. 

Admins can login to the application and can perform Administrator related activities like Password changes, database updates and uploads, Favorites assignment and further activities. All these can be performed from the Admin App itself with the in-built functionalities provided.

Project Name: Order Entry Application and Internet Order Entry Application

Development Environment: DOT NET 3.0, MS SQL Server2005. 

Role: Quality Analyst
Description: 

Advertising: Order Entry application is a feature-rich, Windows-based classified/display advertising and billing system for a variety of publishing environments. It includes an easy-to-use graphical ad entry interface and many customizable features tailored to exact requirements. 

Order Entry works seamlessly with Accounts Receivable and PageMaster Classified Pagination to provide a complete solution from ad entry through production, billing and collections. 

Accounts Receivable: Accounts Receivable is a Windows-based application with full-featured accounts receivable and collection program. It includes an easy-to-use, graphical interface application. Accounts Receivable works seamlessly with Classified and Display to provide integrated advertising accounts receivable and collections.

Internet Order Entry: The process of the Online Internet Order Entry (InternetOE) designed to make it simple for the end Customer to be able to place, design, schedule, and pay for the ad they wish to order from the Lee newspaper site.

The application flow is designed to be user-friendly by allowing the Customer to browse the Package Types, Packages, and Styles all they want before ever registering.  This lets the Customer view the pricing and “kick-the-tires” before ever having to give the site any personal information

Contribution:

· Configuring Network Load Balancing For a SharePoint environment:
Network Load Balancing (NLB) is an optional feature in Windows Server 2008 that load balances network traffic (sent to a cluster virtual IP address) among multiple servers in an NLB cluster. NLB is particularly useful for ensuring that stateless applications, such as a Web server running Internet Information Services (IIS), are scalable by adding additional servers as the load increases. 
· Enabling Kerberos Authentication Mechanism For SharePoint environment: 
Kerberos is a secure protocol that grants authentication tickets if the client’s request to the Key Distribution Centre (KDC) contains valid user credentials and a valid Service Principal Name (SPN). Kerberos is the preferred authentication type for SharePoint because it is faster, more secure, and reduces the number of errors you can get with username and passwords than NTLM. If the SharePoint website uses external data (located on different servers than the SharePoint server itself) ex. to SQL databases through web parts the SharePoint server needs Kerberos to delegate the client credentials (the credentials are never sent over the wire, only tickets which the KDC keeps track of).

PROJECT DESCRIPTION: -
GRCM is a combination of 4 to 5 applications which work together to help analyst from investment bank to perform their analysis on global stock market and distribute it to clients all over the world.
Following are the component applications.

1) Coverage – is application/Database which maintains all static data needed for research, like Analyst details, stock details, and research report subscription details.

2)  RSM – Research Subscription Management module.

This is application which is used for assigning subscriptions to clients; this uses the database of coverage.

Here Operations team can set up a new client, and subscribe a new research as per his request.

Following are types of research subscription.

-Analyst Subscriptions – where client subscribes to particular analyst which he/she is interested.

-Periodical subscriptions – Here client subscribes to particular periodical published by bank.

-Region/country subscriptions – Here client can subscribe to particular region/country research which he is interested.

-Sectors Subscriptions – Here client can subscribe to particular sector like oil and gas, IT, Metals and gold, banking. So client will receive all research published on that sector.

3) GRCM – GRCM is front end application, which analyst will use to create a research.

Analysts can create research reports, check-in and checkout, status of the research reports and authorized approvals for writing, publishing those reports.

4) GDP – Global Distribution Platform – this module takes care of distribution of research.

-Once research is approved GDP distributes the research document, based on subscription for that research the client will receive the hard copy or the soft copy of the research document

on daily/weekly/monthly basis.

5) R1 Database: It manages all stock related financial information regarding all stocks.

Like financial numbers, forecasted data, historical data. This numbers are tagged to the particular stock tagged to the research.

PROJECT DESCRIPTION: -
FMS -> Financial Messaging System is software application within DB, responsible for the successful implementation of the new financial messaging solution. GTX (Global Technology Exchange) concept which is the bottom-line product that handles most of the deutsche bank’s SWIFT FIN traffic. GTX supports multiple networks like SWIFT, SIC, Telex, Fax, Email. It provides a single window access to all of the SWIFT services (FIN, RMA, File ACT, InterACT). GTX can be called as backbone of FMS application, which connects all the backend channels through multi-connectors and delivers web services to external applications in the context of service oriented architecture (SOA).
SWIFT- Society for Worldwide Interbank Financial Telecommunication is a network established to have common standards for financial transactions and a shared data processing system.

The main components of FMS application are:
CBT - Computer Based Terminal, message validation takes place and gets distributed to different nodes.
NPI - Network processing Integration, inbound/outbound messages are processed.

GT Bridge - is a layer through which the messages are flown from CBT/NPI as well as to the backend channels. This layer is responsible for delivery/failure of messages.
OMS - Output Management System, a DB developed product which handles all printing/emails.

Message types:

MT940 - regular basis statement.

MT942 - interim statement sent to the customer on their request.
MT950 – statements sent directly to the customer.

Coming to the application architecture, FMS uses the Resilience concept (Cross configuration), 2 decoupled active instances that replicate their data to the other side. This concept justifies that a failure of one instance does not harm continuous processing of the remaining instance.

 Skilled in leading my teams to handle the entire employee life cycle activities, from a strategic and an operational perspective spread across multiple GEO locations.

· Seasoned HR professional with over a decade of rich and demonstrated experience in leading and managing the entire gamut of HR functions - Compensation & Benefits, Talent Acquisition, Training and Development, Performance Management, HR Operations & Quality, HR Analytics, Best Practices, Payroll, Backend Operations, Rewards & Recognition, Statutory Compliances, etc. in the Telecom, Engineering Services, Manufacturing, IT Products & Services Industry.
· Been instrumental in organically growing organizations up to 700% in capacity.
· Experienced in setting up new HR practices, process and policies in startup organizations or revamping redundant processes in existing setups with lean 6 Σ practices to meet strategic business expectations.
· Founded a HR consulting organization and also ventured into 5 separate ventures, wealth security, a home tutor aggregator, WhatsApp advertising and also into stock market advisory.
· Ability to review legal agreements, strong working knowledge of employment laws, familiarity with best HR practices in the industry, ability to problem solve and generate effective and pragmatic solutions to complex situations as helps me play the role of a standby corporate legal advisor too.





KEY HIGHLIGHTS & ACCOMPISHMENTS

· Successfully designed and implemented Reward and Recognition programs.
· Certified Green Belt.

· Awarded with the multiple Extra Miler awards for taking in additional responsibility in pitching as the temporary replacement to the country HR head and also in another case in ensuring completion of a critical compensation project for the entire country.

General Manager - HR, Jenesys Technologies Pvt. Ltd. (IT), ● Bangalore, Dec 2013 ~ Jan 2016

SKILLS, ACCOMPLISHMENTS & RESPONSBILITIES

Compensation & Benefits Management
· Demonstrated strong project management skills while involved in multiple benchmarking sessions right from job description - analysis - evaluation - survey participation - mapping - benchmarking - range - salary increase - communication - release of letters - implementations for our Indian Locations with multiple Business Leaders based on internal and external equity.
· Was responsible in implementing the annual compensation benchmark surveys according to the compensation philosophies of the company.
· Handled the HR Budget and corresponding MIS reporting to the corporate annually.
· Played a key role in formulation & implementation of increment, incentive & other remuneration policies.
· Managed the appraisal process across the levels and establishing framework for substantiating Performance Appraisal system linked to Reward Management.
· Worked with Business Leaders and corporate on Performance Appraisals, Annual Revisions and Promotional increases.
· Successfully revised and implemented benefits medical insurance, life insurance, accident Insurance, car lease and other benefits to have the same aligned and harmonized across all our branch locations across the country.

Employee Engagement, Planning & Execution
· Expert in implementing and managing the entire gamut of HR in SMB sector and captive units.
· Had been leader for maximizing savings on the SGA front and also the smooth operation of the company’s Human Resources Department.
· Been the advisory member to management on future strategic staffing plans, compensation impacts, competitive benefits, training and development, budget savings, and smooth employee relations.
· Responsible for making strategic decisions on the HR front while defining effective SLA’s and TAT’s of teams based on the policy deployment of the organization.
· Plan, design, develop and evaluate human resource-related initiatives that support organizational goals and also improve employee engagement.
· Initiated a social welfare group “SPARSH” with various employee led fun and CSR activities 
· Initiated focused groups to engage employees and to enable themselves to identify winners across the teams for the “Wall of Fame” quarterly.

Talent Acquisition
· Lead my team on the complete recruitment life-cycle until delivery by enabling my team source the best talent at all levels from diverse cost effective sources.
· Conceptualized and implemented Recruitment Score cards and Dashboards, thereby giving visibility to hiring costs and sourcing right talent at the right times and highly reducing recruitment cycle time.
· Advance planning manpower requirements in consultation with business heads of different functional & operational teams.
· Empowering my team on improvising the induction programs, effective contract negotiations, revising policy & procedures, etc.

Training & Development
· Streamlined the training process, development of Skill Matrix, improving employee’s competency level through in-house training and best practice sharing.
· Promoted a high performance culture by identifying key competencies and skills required across levels, Gap identification and develop strategies to bridge the gap.
· Developed tools for training impact assessment and trainer efficiency evaluation.
· Help my team identify and tie up with vendors to deliver specialized training programs as per the Training Need Analysis and Training calendar.
· Identification of next level leaders, resources with key and critical roles across the organization and implemented strategic succession planning tools, thereby ensuring smooth transition during leadership churn.

Performance Management
· Have been the lead for the overall performance management annually in the organizations as per norms.
· Responsible for addressing employee development needs based on the skill matrix and competency model.
· Successfully revamped the Performance Review discussions with greater thrust on openness, specific feedback, detailed documentation, midterm reviews and focus on skill gap.
· Successfully developed initiatives on Employee Development and Succession Planning.
· Implemented a digitized tool for Performance Improvement Plan for employees rated Needs Improvement.

HR Operations
· Responsible for ensuring all policies and procedures are up to date and legally compliant, maintain a succession plan for all departments and develop a culture that enables employees to perform as per the company’s objectives.
· Lead my team in managing the employee orientation and training programs, benefits plan, policies and guidelines, employee database management & documentation.
· Prepare, analyze and distribute various MIS reports on HR metrics to business leaders to ensure expectations are met, and to evaluate HR team effectiveness.
· Initiated “We Care” open forum for employee’s grievances and issues.
· Was involved in the redesigning of the Compensation Structure.
· Oversee the Regulatory activities impacting the India entity including ensuring that any tax, employment / labour laws, immigration, Regulatory remuneration changes are all complied with.

HR Effectiveness & Digitization
· Implemented Live HR Dashboards instead of regular MIS reporting to the leadership teams.
· Conceptualized and implemented a standby HRIS till Oracle HRMS module was implemented.
· Developed a digitized tool for Evaluation of GET’s as per the company’s values and performance criteria.
· Designed and implemented online tools for effective vendor management
· Conceptualized and implemented Recruitment Score cards and Dashboards, thereby giving visibility to hiring costs and sourcing right talent at the right times and highly reducing recruitment cycle time.
· Took the lead in digitizing existing legacy payroll system and move into a cloud based system for automated Statutory MIS reporting and employee personal data handling

Change Management & Organizational Development
· Acted as a change agent for implementing HR processes for new acquisitions.
· Played an active part in the “Good to Great” team where best practices, EOS evaluations and findings were tracked and monitored.
· Been a POSH committee member for sexual harassment cases and a whistle blower for violations to organizational culture.
· Had restructured the legacy HR team to cater to a wider population by moving into a shared services model primarily for payroll and recruitment.

Industrial Relations
· The India leadership team had identified me as a key resource to be deputed at the manufacturing plant at Kolkata for exposure to IR activities.
· Was responsible for overall activities (canteen, gardens, security, contract labour, etc.) for the manufacturing plants.
· I have had the opportunity to work with unions and take up various IR interventions including reviewing COD and mediate on settlements.

Business HR & Client Relationships
· Engaging with heads of new clients on resource requirement, availability and capability building.
· Held responsibility for settling issues of resources deployed at client locations.
· Ensure the vendors base is adequately qualified and compliant with client requirements.

Project Management & Delivery
· Have managed and led teams while working with multiple stakeholders across the globe till final delivery on various HR digitization and compensation projects.

Strategic HR
· Played key role effectively developing implementing the local strategies for HR interventions as driven by the global policy deployment criteria for resource and talent management.
· Also was involved in advising and recommending the management team on action plans for employee satisfaction and retention of key rated employees.

Legal & Compliance
· Investigating integrity, harassment issues.

· Issue of general / showcause notices as needed (absconding employees, vendor compliance etc.)
· Legal Advisory to the Management team.

Global & Corporate Team Nexus
· Have travelled globally for HR Conferences to meet HR leaders of various countries, and have worked with global corporate teams on consolidating, Headcounts, Recruitment Status, Compensation and Benefits Benchmarking projects, etc.
· Coordinate with global HR team on weekly basis / updates on HR dashboard analytics, information sharing, best practices implementations, policy deployment, business-specific updates, implementation of global processes and identify risks and opportunities for improvement in the HR function including efficiencies and synergies across global HR teams.

	BIP (Business Intelligence Platform)

	 
	Project Description:Business Intelligence Platform is the central repository of data used by different projects and various analytics teams of the bank.

Data are directly sourced from major bank systems and are integrated in a common data layer. BIP’s design philosophy is to make the data reusable across different project implementations and available to different banking users. Using different tools to connect to BIP, different teams are enabled to support MIS, Analytics, and even regulatory reporting requirements. 

The overview of data flow and data transformation from source applications to the different BIP layers then to the downstream marts and views

Process begins where data are extracted from source files and processed in Informatica to handle data type exceptions and to complete other file validations. Data is then loaded to OIA (Operational Image Area) after source key validation for full files or for maintenance of snapshots where incremental data from source is received or for maintaining history, if applicable. Data exceptions are loaded to separate tables for tracking/resolution.

Data from OIA are transformed based on the source-to-target mapping specifications and BMAP/reference table validations to fit into the BIP Common Data Model (CDM) / SIM (Simplified Integrated Model) and to consolidate/apply changes to the CDM/SIM history tables. 

Data from CDM/SIM are extracted and transformed for downstream usage. Transient tables may be utilized to simplify complex transformations. Transformation of target reference values to the business values are also performed in this layer. 

Transformed data from CDM/SIM layer are loaded to downstream target tables for commonly-used information and user-driven requirements.. 

Transformed and untransformed views are made available to downstream users for reporting, analysis, and data mining via different reporting tools such as SAS, Qlikview, BO, etc. 

	 
	Project Contribution:- Data Modelling for 200 + URs ( User Requests)

This law provides an entitlement of up to 12 weeks of job-protected, unpaid leave during any 12-month period to eligible, covered employees. Apart from this FMLA there are around 40 different leave plan types in various states of USA. TAM is an automated information system for tracking employee leaves and absence.
